See which movies / shows are popular

Source: R/trakt-automated-lists.R
automated_lists.Rd

According to the API docs, popularity is calculated based both ratings and number of ratings. Trending items are those being watched right now, where items with the most users watching are returned first. Anticipation is measured by the number of user-created lists an items is part of while not being released yet.

trakt.popular(type = c("shows", "movies"), limit = 10,
  extended = c("min", "full"), query = NULL, years = NULL,
  genres = NULL, languages = NULL, countries = NULL,
  runtimes = NULL, ratings = NULL, certifications = NULL,
  networks = NULL, status = NULL)

trakt.trending(type = c("shows", "movies"), limit = 10,
  extended = c("min", "full"), query = NULL, years = NULL,
  genres = NULL, languages = NULL, countries = NULL,
  runtimes = NULL, ratings = NULL, certifications = NULL,
  networks = NULL, status = NULL)

trakt.anticipated(type = c("shows", "movies"), limit = 10,
  extended = c("min", "full"), query = NULL, years = NULL,
  genres = NULL, languages = NULL, countries = NULL,
  runtimes = NULL, ratings = NULL, certifications = NULL,
  networks = NULL, status = NULL)

trakt.played(type = c("shows", "movies"), limit = 10,
  extended = c("min", "full"), period = c("weekly", "monthly",
  "yearly", "all"), query = NULL, years = NULL, genres = NULL,
  languages = NULL, countries = NULL, runtimes = NULL,
  ratings = NULL, certifications = NULL, networks = NULL,
  status = NULL)

trakt.watched(type = c("shows", "movies"), limit = 10,
  extended = c("min", "full"), period = c("weekly", "monthly",
  "yearly", "all"), query = NULL, years = NULL, genres = NULL,
  languages = NULL, countries = NULL, runtimes = NULL,
  ratings = NULL, certifications = NULL, networks = NULL,
  status = NULL)

trakt.collected(type = c("shows", "movies"), limit = 10,
  extended = c("min", "full"), period = c("weekly", "monthly",
  "yearly", "all"), query = NULL, years = NULL, genres = NULL,
  languages = NULL, countries = NULL, runtimes = NULL,
  ratings = NULL, certifications = NULL, networks = NULL,
  status = NULL)

trakt.updates(type = c("shows", "movies"), limit = 10,
  extended = c("min", "full"), start_date = Sys.Date() - 7)

Arguments

type

character(1): Either "shows" or "movies". For season/episode-specific functions, values seasons or episodes are also allowed.
limit

integer(1) [10L]: Number of items to return. Must be greater than 0 and will be coerced to integer.
extended

character(1): Either "min" (API default) or "full". The latter returns more variables and should generally only be used if required.
query

character(1): Search titles and descriptions.
years

integer(1): 4-digit year or range, e.g. 2010-2020. Can also be an integer vector of length two which will be coerced appropriately.
genres

character(n): Genre slug(s). See genres for a table of genres. Multiple values are allowed and will be concatenated.
languages

character(n): Two-digit language code(s). Also see languages for table of available languages.
countries

character(n): Two-character country code(s). See countries.
runtimes

character | integer: Integer range in minutes, e.g. 30-90. Can also be an integer vector of length two which will be coerced appropriately.
ratings

character | integer: Integer range between 0 and 100. Can also be an integer vector of length two which will be coerced appropriately.
certifications

character(n): Certification(s) like pg-13. Multiple values are allowed. Use certifications for reference. Note that there are different certifications for shows and movies.
networks

character(n): (Shows only) Network name like HBO. See networks for a list of known networks.
status

character(n): (Shows only) The status of the shows. One of returning series, in production, planned, canceled, or ended
period

character(1) ["weekly"]: Which period to filter by. Possible values are "weekly", "monthly", "yearly", "all".
start_date

character(1): A date in the past from which on to count updates. If no date is supplied, the default is to use the date 7 days in the past relative to the current date. Value must either be standard YYYY-MM-DD format or an object of class Date, which will then be coerced via as.character().

Value

A tibble().

Details

These functions access the automatically updated lists provided by trakt.tv. Each function comes in two flavors: Shows or movies. The following descriptions are adapted directly from the API reference.

  • Popular: Popularity is calculated using the rating percentage and the number of ratings.

  • Trending: Returns all movies/shows being watched right now. Movies/shows with the most users are returned first.

  • Played: Returns the most played (a single user can watch multiple times) movies/shows in the specified time period.

  • Watched: Returns the most watched (unique users) movies/shows in the specified time period.

  • Collected: Returns the most collected (unique users) movies/shows in the specified time period.

  • Anticipated: Returns the most anticipated movies/shows based on the number of lists a movie/show appears on.

  • Updates: Returns all movies/shows updated since the specified UTC start_date. In this case, the upper bound for limit is 100.

The functions for Played, Watched, Collected and Played each return the same additional variables besides the media information: watcher_count, play_count, collected_count, collector_count.

Note

trakt.updates does not support filters.

See also

search_filters, for more information on search filters.

Examples

# Get popular shows with only ids
trakt.popular(type = "shows")
#> # A tibble: 10 x 7
#>    title                  year trakt slug                  tvdb   imdb     tmdb 
#>    <chr>                 <int> <chr> <chr>                 <chr>  <chr>    <chr>
#>  1 Game of Thrones        2011 1390  game-of-thrones       121361 tt09449… 1399 
#>  2 Breaking Bad           2008 1388  breaking-bad          81189  tt09037… 1396 
#>  3 The Walking Dead       2010 1393  the-walking-dead      153021 tt15202… 1402 
#>  4 The Big Bang Theory    2007 1409  the-big-bang-theory   80379  tt08982… 1418 
#>  5 Sherlock               2010 19792 sherlock              176941 tt14755… 19885
#>  6 How I Met Your Mother  2005 1095  how-i-met-your-mother 75760  tt04606… 1100 
#>  7 Dexter                 2006 1396  dexter                79349  tt07732… 1405 
#>  8 Arrow                  2012 1403  arrow                 257655 tt21930… 1412 
#>  9 Friends                1994 1657  friends               79168  tt01087… 1668 
#> 10 Lost                   2004 4583  lost-2004             73739  tt04110… 4607 

# Get trending movies with extended information
trakt.trending(type = "movies", 5, extended = "full")
#> # A tibble: 5 x 22
#>   watchers title  year tagline overview released   runtime country trailer
#>      <int> <chr> <int> <chr>   <chr>    <date>       <int> <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1       59 Aven…  2019 Part o… After t… 2019-04-26     181 us      http:/…
#> 2       47 Shaz…  2019 Just S… A boy i… 2019-04-05     132 us      http:/…
#> 3       43 John…  2019 The Gr… John Wi… 2019-05-15     130 us      http:/…
#> 4       29 John…  2017 Never … John Wi… 2017-02-10     122 us      http:/…
#> 5       25 Aqua…  2018 Home I… Once ho… 2018-12-21     144 us      http:/…
#> # … with 13 more variables: homepage <chr>, rating <dbl>, votes <int>,
#> #   comment_count <int>, updated_at <dttm>, language <chr>,
#> #   available_translations <list>, genres <list>, certification <chr>,
#> #   trakt <int>, slug <chr>, imdb <chr>, tmdb <int>

# Get top 5 anticipated movies
trakt.anticipated(type = "movies", 5)
#> # A tibble: 5 x 7
#>   list_count title                year  trakt slug                 imdb     tmdb
#>        <int> <chr>               <int>  <int> <chr>                <chr>   <int>
#> 1      29804 Avatar 2             2021  56580 avatar-2-2021        tt163…  76600
#> 2      28018 Star Wars: The Ris…  2019 114335 star-wars-the-rise-… tt252… 181812
#> 3      22011 The Flash              NA 195144 the-flash            tt043… 298618
#> 4      20197 Dark Phoenix         2019 200946 dark-phoenix-2019    tt656… 320288
#> 5      19589 Justice League 2     2019 193970 justice-league-2-20… tt412… 298619

# Get 15 the most anticipated upcoming shows on Netflix that air this year
current_year <- format(Sys.Date(), "%Y")
trakt.anticipated("shows", limit = 15, networks = "Netflix", years = current_year)
#> # A tibble: 15 x 8
#>    list_count title            year trakt  slug          tvdb  imdb        tmdb 
#>         <int> <chr>           <int> <chr>  <chr>         <chr> <chr>       <chr>
#>  1        562 When They See …  2019 144923 when-they-se… 3603… tt7137906   81355
#>  2        265 7Seeds           2019 140359 7seeds        3560… tt9348718   85940
#>  3        224 Jinn             2019 130869 jinn          3477… tt8923396   <NA>

#>  7         66 The Politician   2019 145654 the-politici… 3614… tt7971476   <NA>

#>  9         56 See You Yester…  2019 146964 see-you-yest… 3629… tt8743064   <NA> 
#> 10         45 Saint Seiya: K…  2019 145687 saint-seiya-… 3514… tt6908976   <NA> 
#> 11         37 It's Bruno       2019 146647 it-s-bruno    3625… tt10186846  <NA> 
#> 12         28 Kengan Ashura    2019 138247 kengan-ashura 3541… tt9058134/  <NA>

# Get the most popular German-language movies between 1990 and 2010
trakt.popular("movies", languages = "de", years = c(1990, 2010))
#> # A tibble: 10 x 6
#>    title                    year trakt slug                       imdb      tmdb
